meanings.definition: A person or group that sets the pace for others to follow.
meanings.sent1: The pacesetter in the marathon led the other runners.
meanings.sent2: The team captain was the pacesetter during practice.
meanings.sent3: The pacesetter in the dance class had everyone trying to keep up.
meanings.sent4: She was the pacesetter in the office, always finishing tasks first.
meanings.sent5: The pacesetter in the choir set a high standard for the group.

meanings.definition: A horse that sets the pace in a race.
meanings.sent1: The pacesetter horse quickly took the lead.
meanings.sent2: The jockey rode the pacesetter confidently.
meanings.sent3: The pacesetter horse seemed to enjoy leading the pack.
meanings.sent4: The pacesetter horse's speed was unmatched.
meanings.sent5: Spectators cheered for the pacesetter as it raced ahead.

meanings.definition: A company or individual that sets a standard for others to follow.
meanings.sent1: The tech company was a pacesetter in innovation.
meanings.sent2: The fashion designer became a pacesetter in the industry.
meanings.sent3: The pacesetter in sustainability practices inspired others to follow suit.
meanings.sent4: Being a pacesetter in customer service, the company gained loyal clients.
meanings.sent5: The artist was a pacesetter, influencing many with their unique style.
